body: LEAD: Regina Winters, 17 years old, grew up in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn, the daughter of a single woman on welfare. She now lives next door to a ''crack house.'' title: FROM NEW YORK'S POOR AREAS TO PRIVATE SCHOOLS

body: LEAD: With the racial violence last month in Queens still on their minds, organizers of religious and cultural activities over the weekend commemorating the birth of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. emphasized that the civil rights leader's vision is as relevant today as it was during his lifetime. With the racial violence last month in Queens still on
title: KING ACTIVITIES AIM TO DEPICT RELEVANCE OF HIS VISION TODAY

body: LEAD: The question of who owns a valuable Jewish library of more than 40,000 books and manuscripts was decided yesterday when a Federal District judge in Brooklyn rejected the claims of a grandson of a Hasidic rabbi and awarded the library instead to the Lubavitch community that the rabbi once headed. The question of who owns a valuable Jewish
title: JUDGE AWARDS RABBI'S LIBRARY TO HASIDIC UNIT

body: LEAD: A Hasidic man who was beaten to unconciousness by a group of black teen-agers on a Brooklyn subway platform last summer died Saturday of his injuries, the police said yesterday. A Hasidic man who was beaten to unconciousness by a group of black teen-agers on a Brooklyn subway platform last summer died Saturday of his injuries, the police said
title: HASSIDIC MAN, HURT IN A RACIAL ATTACK LAST SUMMER, DIES

body: LEAD: Two police officers responding to a reported robbery at a Brooklyn tavern early yesterday were themselves held up by the robbers, who took their revolvers and herded them into a back room with patrons, the police said. Two police officers responding to a reported robbery at a Brooklyn tavern early yesterday were themselves held up by the
title: 2 OFFICERS SENT TO BAR HOLDUP, ROBBED OF GUNS

body: LEAD: The lawyers for two of the black men who were beaten in the Howard Beach racial incident asserted yesterday that their clients had refused to cooperate with the Queens District Attorney because prosecutors were ''making a case'' for the white defendants. The lawyers for two of the black men who were beaten in the Howard Beach racial incident
title: LAWYERS FOR QUEENS ASSAULT VICTIMS EXPLAIN REFUSAL TO AID INVESTIGATIONS
